intro: Hieracium chiariglionei, commonly known as the Chiariglione hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and open habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
